instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> // 820 - 4924 - A // Orange light not powering on
threads.message:
Hey everyone, this is a strange one, there is no water damage no corrosion.


I followed the first few steps of the video below:
[MEDIA=youtube]r2HyzGwH7Z[/MEDIA]


Getting the following readings:

PP Bus : 12.56 volts

not sure what to measure next, so stuck now

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> // 820 - 4924 - A // Orange light not powering on
threads.message:
Start checking <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS.
Post <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> and all PCH's RTC signals.
Be sure to use 60/85W original Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> // 820 - 4924 - A // Orange light not powering on
threads.message:
Using original 85 watt charger! 

In the video above, what are the next two items being measured?
